replies.bodyText:
FWIW, I generally like to see questions about code be answered by updating the code.
IE:

Reviewer: "This area of the code is unclear"
Author: "I have updated the code here, '' to try and clarify, let me know if that covers it?"
Reviewer: "Yes, the update clears up the question, thank you".

In other words, a reviewer is simulating a future developer that is reading through code. The questions/answers in a PR are of very low value because they are ephemeral. It is a sad day when you have to start looking through PRs to understand the code as written.
With that all aside, let's optimize our setup instructions for someone getting setup. I don't know if there is any value in setting up a project-specific config without having the project checked out. The easiest way to start is to clone, then open IDEA, "open" > select the 'build.gradle' file, then IDEA will automatically add triplea as a gradle roject. From there, the checkstyle config is project specific, specific to TripleA and AFAIK you really need to have the project set up to configure that.
